page.title: 05HEALTH CARE
page.content: HEALTH CARE There are no medical facilities available in the immediate vicinity and visits to doctors, dentists and chiropodists have to be made by bus or private transport. There is a visiting District Nurse for housebound people and also a Meals on Wheels service for those who are eligible and wish to make use of it. The General Hospital serving the area is about twelve miles away and this includes a Consultant Maternity Unit. Home confinements are not catered for but there is a community midwifery service to monitor ante natal and post natal care. The Ambulance Service is available for hospital appointments where necessary and also for admissions.
